subject: Fashion
title: The Polyester Revolution
description: A fast breakdown of The Polyester Revolution for builders.

hook.text: Polyester makes up over half of all clothing produced today.

buildup.text: Introduced in the 1950s, it was cheap, wrinkle-resistant, and easy to dye.

discovery.text: The 1970s polyester leisure suit became a cultural punchline.

climax.text: Polyester's problem: it's plastic, sheds microfibers, and takes centuries to decompose.

punchline.text: Fashion's favorite fabric is also its biggest pollutant.
